intro: Cladocarpa discoidea, commonly known as the "disco-shaped cup" or "disk cup," is a unique member of the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, cup-like structure that forms a hollow, disk-shaped receptacle. The plant exhibits a low-growing habit with dense, dark green foliage and produces small, white or pale flowers. Its botanical features include a woody stem and a specialized floral structure that aids in pollination. Cladocarpa discoidea is native to specific regions in South America and is adapted to moist, shaded environments.
